content.description: P1 5.9+ G: Climb the face up the left-facing corner and follow the corner to its end. Work up a crack left of an arête and follow it to the top.
content.location: Left end of the main wall, 10' left of the attractive overhanging fingercrack, below an obvious small left-facing corner

content.description: Starts the same as Drag Queen and Divine, but follows the crack trending right instead of the two going left. Not particularly hard, but a little dirty — protection rating could also improve if it was a bit more clean. Towards the top, you run into Drama Queen/Short Fiction, but stay more on the face instead of the arete for a better time and more interesting moves. For fun, you can sling a natural horn/pocket thing for pro after you move past it!
content.protection: Single rack, smaller gear helpful but not imperative. the slung handle/horn is arguably the best piece.
content.location: Between Drag Queen and Short Fiction

content.description: Can be led or top roped.
content.location: On the left wall, this is the most prominent feature on the entire cliff.

climbs.name: Drama Queen  (a.k.a. "Short Fiction")
climbs.fa: 2011 Valerie Bachinsky & Kevin Heckeler, 2000(?) Jason Brechko

content.description: P1 5.5 G: Climb up the arête following cracks straight up to the top.
content.location: At the right end of the right main wall is an arete, start below (and slightly left of) the arete.

content.description: P1 5.6 G: Up the rightmost, left-trending, thin-hands crack past a jutting flake to its end. Step right and follow a thin crack up the face to the top.
content.location: 10' left of Drama Queen below the rightmost of three obvious cracks in the face, at two stacked blocks.

content.description: P1 5.6 G: Climb up and left to a stance, follow the middle of the crack systems, staying slightly left.  Use the second of two vertical finger cracks to reach the top.
content.location: Take middle line on wall (left of Drag Queen), left of Drama Queen's arete at a face with several left leaning cracks.  Shares start with Drag Queen.

content.description: P1 5.8 G: Boulder up 8' to a ledge (crux), then up the chimney. Go behind a large chockstone to emerge at the top.
content.location: At the obvious chimney, which is just right of the attractive, overhanging fingercrack.

content.description: P1 5.7+ G: Boulder up to a small ledge at the base of the thin crack in the face. Climb the left-trending, thin crack to the top of the chimney corner ("Disappearing Act").
content.location: Left of Divine below the leftmost of three obvious cracks in the face.

content.description: P1 5.4 G: Climb the initial head-wall up 5' to the large ledge. Climb the left of two hand and fist cracks up 30' and traverse right 10'. Follow the hand crack to the top.
content.location: Left end of the main wall,  5' Left of Scorpion Bowl around the corner.

content.description:
Scenic cliff above Lake George.  Offers quality moderate climbs that would also be ideal beginner's leads. 

  Several locals have climbed here over the years, focusing mostly on the beautiful and prominent crack that has yet to be sent free (dubbed "The Chingacrack" by Jason Brechko, previously named "Eagle Crack" when TR'd in 1997).  Only recently did Mike Gray, Todd Paris, and Valerie Bachinsky develop the remaining wall.
